channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Manhunt for Charlie Kirk’s Killer, and Putin’s Defiant Message
item.description: Plus, why firefighters are sounding an alarm.

item.title: What Drove Israel’s Attack on Hamas in Qatar?
item.description: Israeli officials and analysts say that revenge for the Hamas-led 2023 attack on Israel, and frustration over moribund Gaza truce negotiations, inform...

item.title: Charlie Kirk’s murder is the latest violent act to put public-facing leaders on edge
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Was Practicing Politics the Right Way
item.description: The foundation of a free society is the ability to participate in politics without fear of violence. To lose that is to risk losing everything.

item.title: South Korean Leader Warns of U.S. Investments After Hyundai-LG Plant Raid
item.description: President Lee Jae Myung made the comments as hundreds of South Korean workers swept in an immigration raid were expected to fly home on Thursday.

item.title: Google’s AI is the ‘worst’ for stealing content, says People CEO
item.description: But Google-owned YouTube could provide a model for media and AI to coexist and thrive, says internet industry pioneer Bill Gross.

item.title: UK Ambassador to the U.S., Peter Mandelson, Forced Out Over Epstein Links
item.description: The British government said it had withdrawn the envoy after newly revealed emails showed the depth of his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Job-hopping Gen Z only stay in each job 1 year and 54% are regularly browsing for their next role—but a report says they’re not disloyal villains
item.description: While Gen Xers and baby boomers stayed in their first jobs for around 3 years, Gen Z are ditching their employers yearly without the promise of bigger...

item.title: Is there a crypto bubble? Yes, says CEO of $15 billion exchange Kraken
item.description: Arjun Sethi said he’s bullish long term but believes we’re in a short-term hype cycle.

item.title: The ‘Great Lock-In’ is more than a Gen Z TikTok trend—it’s a rejection of millennials’ ‘soft life’ and taking back power in this economy
item.description: Remember when "hustle culture" was a thing, then generation burnout? That's such a millennial way of looking at things.

item.title: South Korean Leader Warns of U.S. Investments After Hyundai-LG Plant Raid
item.description: President Lee Jae Myung made the comments as hundreds of South Korean workers swept in an immigration raid were expected to fly home on Thursday.

item.title: Drone Barrage Over Poland Was a Test for NATO, and the U.S.
item.description: A continent already on edge over the Ukraine war sees a Russian challenge to NATO readiness and to an America that wants to disengage from Europe.

item.title: UK Ambassador to the U.S., Peter Mandelson, Forced Out Over Epstein Links
item.description: The British government said it had withdrawn the envoy after newly revealed emails showed the depth of his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Nepal’s Young Protesters Find an Unlikely Partner: The Army
item.description: After an explosion of popular rage tore through the country, its respected army was the only institution left standing. It’s now in talks with the pro...
